statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 18 \\ -9 \\ -3 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 18 \\ -9 \\ -3 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] is a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right].
